content.question: Two different wires are both carrying uniform currents. Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has a cross-sectional area <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, resistivity <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and a current <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has a cross-sectional area <math alttext="2 A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, resistivity <math alttext="3 rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>ρ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and a current <math alttext="2 I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="E sub 2, to E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> of the electric field magnitude in Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> to the electric field magnitude in Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
